title: [K-12] Online Education Design Based on Performing Arts for Fostering 21st-Century Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary social studies teaching experience and basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented program for teacher professional development in smartphone-centric mobile learning environments.

learning_goals: Role-playing and situational drama techniques can enhance the ability to design social problem-solving projects.

Learners can discuss solutions to social issues (e.g., school violence prevention, environmental protection) in teams of 3â€“4 members using digital collaboration tools (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat) for two weeks and write an implementation plan according to role distribution with over 80% completeness (based on teacher evaluation criteria).

Learners can design a 3-session creative social studies lesson plan using theatrical expression techniques (gestures, voice, improvisation) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) in peer evaluation and teacher feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
